13.text: Here's some of the top ways

14.text: you can be safe as you bike.

19.text: a good bike check is in order.

24.text: Make sure your front and rear lights are working

26.text: and are able to be seen by those around you.

28.text: If you have them on but they are being blocked by a bag

31.text: then they won't really do you any good.

34.text: Check that your tires are pumped to the correct air pressure.

37.text: You can find out how much pressure your tires require

40.text: by reading the information on the sidewall of your tire.

46.text: Brakes should be free from the tire when disengaged

49.text: and have a tight grip when engaged.

53.text: Give your pedal a little kick before your ride

56.text: The chain should move smoothly over the gears.

61.text: These are the levers that lock your tire in place.

64.text: Make sure they are closed and tight.

79.text: If you have a drivers liscence

80.text: then you already know the rules of the road when cycling

83.text: because the rules are the same.

86.text: You're a vehicle too, so you should...

92.text: and don't ride on the sidewalk.

100.text: Use hand signals to tell drivers where you're heading.

103.text: When signaling use your left hand to signal left

107.text: your right hand to signal right

109.text: and your left hand down to signal stop.

112.text: To change lanes look over your shoulder multiple times

115.text: to make sure your path is clear.

118.text: Signal and move into the lane smoothly and deliberately.

128.text: and keep your eyes peeled for danger.

132.text: Anticipate what drivers, pedestrians, and other cyclists might do next.

136.text: Watch for turning vehicles and look out for debris,

142.text: You can even practice dodging obstacles with items from home.

152.text: and when you have to drive in those places

158.text: The door zone is an area just outside parallel parked cars.

162.text: When riding in the door zone

164.text: you run the risk of a door being opened

169.text: To ride safely next to parallel parked vehicles

172.text: move out of the door zone

173.text: and don't be afraid to take the lane.

175.text: Now that you know how to keep yourself safe on the bike

178.text: make sure you keep your bike safe too.

181.text: always lock your bike when you leave it unattended.

201.text: lower the bike rack on the front of the bus

205.text: put your bike on the rack

210.text: Pull the arm out and raise it to the top of your tire.
